heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 17 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (194°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.8°C) and outside temperature (down 1.8°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 3065 lux) and cloud levels (up 252 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm) and cloud levels (up 550 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 252.2m lower than yesterday, 72.2m higher than the past week, 549.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 702m and a high of 2980m, averaging 1345.5m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, humidity will be high and noticeable and calm and still conditions are expected. Showers, occasional overcast conditions, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
